content.detailedDescription:
Narrativa en espa���ol:

   al momento de tener este encuentro, me encontraba en la ciudad leon, guanajuato, mexico, exactamente en la bodega de un cliente, habiamos terminado de descargar un cami���n tipo torton, en ese momento sali de la bodega para pagar el flete, por lo regular procuro siempre estar viendo el cielo, en ese momento observe estos objetos en forma parecida a un diamante, con algo colgando en la parte de abajo, similar a un paracaidas con una persona abajo, estaban volando en formacion, sus movimientos no eran herraticos, mas bien parecian inteligentes, se desplazaban de oriente a poniente, en linea recta ascendente.

   la tarde era nublada, al momento de pasar frente a mi los fotografie, al mismo tiempo le comente al chofer del camion de la precencia de estos objetos, el tambien se sorprendio, el lugar exacto de este encuentro es en el centro de la ciudad, por lo cual, descarto que sean paracaidas, ademas, los objetos tenian una trayectoria ascendente, ustedes pueden observar como fue barrida la imagen en donde tenia la objeto mas cercano, se ve como solo una "mancha", es raro como se pueden apreciar mejor los objetos mas lejanos, pude observar en la flotilla cerca de 8 objetos, el objeto que paso mas cercano a mi lo observe perfectamente, no emitia ruido y le calculo un diametro estructural de 16 metros cuadrados aprox.

   al momento de pasar frente a mi y en los siguientes 2 minutos, pude observar como ascendian en forma recta, concentre mi atencion en el objeto mas cercano que tuve en su momento y vi como ahora subio en linea recta, tuve la oportunidad de avisarle a mi cliente para que saliera de la bodega, el salio y pudo observar como el objeto se perdio en las nuves, al perderse este objeto en los proximos 2 segundo empezo a llover relativamente fuerte.


   mis dudas son las siguientes:
��� estos objetos no contaban con alas
��� no vi motor aparente que las impulsara hacia arriba
��� no es posible que se practique el paracaidismo en plena ciudad
��� a una altura tan baja
��� y mucho menos podia imaginar como un objeto sin motor aparente se   desplazara de abajo hacia arriba, cuando lo logico es a la inversa.


   de este hecho, solo tengo a mi cliente de testigo, ya que el chofer del cami���n tipo torton era un proveedor circunstancial, estos hechos y estas fotografias no las he mostrado a nadie, ustedes son la primer organizacion a la cual le he comentado estos hechos, me dieron mucha confianza al ver su programa.

p.D. tengo 9 fotos, este site solo acepta 3, si estan interesados indiqueme donde le puedo mandar las otras 6 fotos.
content.summary: Ufo fleet type cross.

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were with family and friends at his sister's lake house on pewaukee lake on july 4, 2009.  the annual fireworks show had just finished and we were talking amongst ourselves before preparing to leave.  best i can remember, the time was somewhere near or a bit before 10:00 pm central daylight time.  some of us, including myself, were watching for additional fireworks behind the tree line across the lake.  there are other towns and villages in the vacinity that host fireworks shows, so it's not uncommon to see multiple shows going on simultaneously on the fourth of july.  i was looking at the risen moon and noticed a large orange-red object "floating" in the sky, coming from the east.  i told my husband and he watched the object.  he initially thought it might be a helicopter.  the color was intense.  i am an amateur astronomer and have been observing the night sky for nearly thirty years.  i'd never seen an aircraft with lights the color of this object, but i was open to any terrestrial explanation.  the moon was nearly full and the sky had scattered clouds in it.  at first i thought that maybe this object was a left-over firework but it never exploded and it kept coming toward the house.  some of us were watching as the object slowed to a halt, hovered above where we were standing, then begin to ascend into a thin cloud and disappear.  we were all nonplussed.  this object was acting unlike any terrestrial object i'd ever seen.  i went into the house and came back out about a minute later and saw that a similar object was again in the sky, again in the east and moving toward the house, but in a more southerly direction.  i took a photo of the object with our canon xti digital camera.  i made sure to snap a section of the tree at the foot of the patio so that i could get the object on the frame.  i didn't lose sight of the object until i turned to go back into the house.  when i came back out a third time, it was gone.  however, my sister-in-law said that after i went into the house, it was making a movement that was unusual.  as far as feelings and reactions go, i'm always curious about the night sky and have seen strange objects all of my life, so it's not uncommon for me.  however, to be in the presence of so many others who were observing the same object was a thrill.  i had witnesses to what i was observing.  i do not know what it was and even thought that it might be ball lightning, but it occurred twice (or was it two separate objects?).  all i would like is to know if others saw this event and reported it, and whether or not my photo can help determine what it might have been.  i hope this information is helpful in your research.
content.summary: Orange-red bright sphere seen over pewaukee lake, waukesha county, wisconsin.

content.detailedDescription: We were driving north on 435 about 4 miles southeast of kansas city international airport.  we saw several planes around the area then we noticed an orange orb flying low bascially following interstate 435 toward the southeast in the opposite direction of us.  there were 4 of us in the car that all witnessed and watched this.  we watched it for about 2 minutes until it was too far south to see it.  there was a plane that flew about 1,000 feet right above the orb so you could distinctly tell the difference between a blinking plane and this orange orb.  the orb was flying slow, i would guess around 30 mph and about 100' to 200' above the ground.  it was flying in a very straight line not eradic at all.
content.summary: Orange orb flying low heading southeast.

content.detailedDescription:
My father was arriving home from a friend's house at around 11:00 pm and saw two large orange lights that seemed to be connected hovering and rotating across the lake.  he ran inside and got my cousin and i to come out and check out the lights with him.  the lights continued to rotate and slowly drift across the sky for about 3 minutes when they disappeared either behind a cloud or just drifted off.

then, as we were walking into the house, i looked back once more and saw 3 identical lights which were in the shape of an equilateral triangle rising from the same spot as the first two lights.  they did the same movements, drifted off in the same direction and also disappeared.

the lights were too large/slow moving to be a plane.  were in the air for far too long to be any sort of firework and generally hovered and behaved in a way that was unlike anything we'd ever seen.

did anyone else see this?
content.summary: 3 orange/amber lights hovering/rotating in formation.

content.detailedDescription:
It was july 4th 2009 about 930 pm maybe later. me, my wife and son were in the backyard in the swimming pool (open yard, no screen) watching the fireworks all around the neighborhood. very clear night had good view of stars even with the full moon well almost full there was like a tiny bit on the side still in shadow like 1%. everything looked pretty good from our view we can see in all directions and low in the horizon. my wife said ohh look at that one, i turned and looked and before i could say anything she was like oh that���������s weird. when i 1st looked at it i thought maybe someone close by maybe a few blocks away had shot a flare off. then i realized what i was seeing was no flare just by the way it was moving. it was moving from a west to east or ne maybe but flew right over our heads then i thought it was a missile maybe, my wife said it���������s a ufo, my son said maybe it���������s a comet maybe. i know a little about astronomy and have a powerful telescope so i knew it wasn���������t a plane or comet its speed was that of maybe a satellite or a little faster going by. we watched it go over head and towards the east till we couldn���������t see it no more it looked like a mini sun orange in color was very bright when we 1st seen it then faded as it moved away. i���������d say it's size was well bigger then venus or any of the brightest stars you could see with the naked eye but not to much bigger. we all decided it was a ufo and thought how lucky we were to see it together. fact we really thought it was awesome and none of us were or became afraid. this is not the 1st time my wife and i have seen something of this nature but that is another story. this is the 1st time we ever reported made a report or anything. i feel it's time to tell the people of the world the truth. we can handle it. were human beings we can handle anything.

thank you.
content.summary: Seen what looked like a ball of fire or mini sun move from west to east or ne.

content.detailedDescription:
At the hingham bathing beach on sunday july 5, we had gathered to watch the annual fireworks display, launched from button island.  we were facing northeast.  our attention was drawn to an orange-red object in the southeastern sky.  it was maybe the size of a bb held at arm's length.
at first we thought it was a plane, as the flight path to logan airport was in our line of sight from south to north (right to left).  but it was a round ball of light that looked like fire, not the typical lights associated with commercial aircraft.  then the light appeared to stop moving and hovered in one position for 5 to 10 minutes.  then, the direction of travel reversed to the south-southeast and the object moved away at a high rate of speed, first horizontally and then vertically.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Orange light moved left, hovered for 5-10 minutes, reversed direction, and retreated at a high rate of speed.

content.detailedDescription:
This will be the third sighting i've had in this area in under a year.
i was looking up into the sky while assisting my husband while he worked on our neighbors roof. i was watching him on the roof when i spotted a reddish metallic orb fly over. my initial reaction was it's just a mylar balloon. as it flew overhead i noticed the orb's path was very straight, and was flying through the strong western wind we had that day. i got excited and shouted up to my husband to look up, i ran over to the side of the house he was on and shouted, "look up, look up!" i watched it until the treeline blocked my view of the sky.
when my husband got down form the ladder he asked me what i was shouting about and when i told him he was upset that he missed another sighting in our own backyard.
content.summary: Reddish orb moving across strong wind.

content.detailedDescription: At 12:00 midnight i went out on my deck for some fresh air and looking towards the eastern sky slightly to the south which would be approx. over gay ga. i noticed several bright lights which were in a row and seemed to be like a star cluster,   they appeared to be on one vehicle and attached, they then moved up into the sky at a high rate of speed and then stopped and hovered.   when they moved up i noticed that they covered a long distance in such a short amount of time that it could not have been an airplane.  i ran into my house and called my three teenage sons up from our den where they were playing video games, they came outside and all four of us watched the ufo for over an hour as it moved up and down in the sky.  at one point it dropped down in the sky a good distance and then climbed back to where it was, it also seemed to move side to side frequently.  we also noticed what appeared to be a trail behind the ufo when ever it made a fast movement, we took a very bright flash light we have and signaled the ufo for about 10 minutes and it moved higher into the sky closer to our house but still a long ways away.  after an hour or so we went back into the house, perhaps some sort of army tests, we were not afraid but it was pretty cool to watch it, it was not a copter or an airplane.
content.summary: Saw numerous bright lights move up in the sky and then hover back and forth.

content.detailedDescription:
I was the only one in the target parking lot from about 10:10pm to 10:25pm, taking a few fireworks pictures. just trying out my new nikon. 
i was waiting to see if there were going to be anymore fireworks, and noticed an orange ball of light. it was moving in a straight line from north to south. it was almost right over me. at first i thought it might be a plane. but no noise, and no typical airplane lights...Red, white, green. i got my camera and got out of the car, and took four pictures. and then got my film camera and took a couple more on film, which i haven't got developed yet. but the digital photos came out really good. i'll post them as soon as possible. my computer is running too slow to up-load right now.  i watched it moving south untill i couldn't make it out anymore. the whole sighting lasted maybe 3-4 minutes. 
this is the 3rd actual sighting i've had in the last two years.  
i got two good photos last year on july 24th. you can definately tell that these are not planes or balloons, or helicopters, etc.
content.summary: Orange ball of light travling north to south in westfield in.   july 5th, 2009, 10:20 pm.

content.detailedDescription: While setting off a few fireworks with my 2 boys, ages 12 & 9yrs, we noticed a large orange ball in the western sky.  thinking it was going to be a firework display, i stated to my boys, "here comes a big one" but it never exploded.  it moved in a straight horizonal line at about 45 degrees fromt the horizon and moved due north, never rising or falling from that line of view.  it moved at a consistant speed towards the north until it disappeared from sight, this being approximately 30-45 seconds.  it did not blink or flash and no sound was heard.  i'm sure a few of the surrounding neighbors witnessed the same thing because the fireworks suddenly ceased until it moved out of sight.  i quickly contacted a friend, a nasa embassador with her own observatory, to question if anything was scheduled to be in the sky at that time....Nothing.  i don't know what it was but it sure sparked my interest and couriousity.
content.summary: Bright orange round light

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks in the sky then notice an bright orange light moving fast toward us then stopped n the sky we starred at it ti see if it was a plane or jet then we said planes or jets dont stop then we thought it might be the helicopter then said that is way to high to be a helicopter so we stared at it for a few minutes then watch it move around that same area then flash of and on then it went from left to right up and down then disapear out of the sky. this was strange then a few minutes later it re-appeared on the left side of the moon and did the same exact thing as before. so we recorded it sorry not a good video.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: Bright orange/red light blinking.

content.detailedDescription: Awoke from a bad dream, went outside and saw usual subject now in northern sky, and suddenly 3 separate objects appeared and traveled north to south, separately, not together, 2 of them were headed due south but 3rd one was headed south and turned east. all 3 were visable for 5 minutes minimum then disappeared, due to impending sunrise ? have seen the same object in sky over a year but now 3 others moving at great rate of speed accross sky, no noise, no lights just reflecting off sun beyond horizon. this was 1st time ever saw anything like this before
content.summary: 3 objects traveling north to south, tracked each for 5 mins then disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside grilling and watching the stars at about 2:30am on july 6th (night of july 5th).  the first object i noticed as a dim object, which i initially took to be a satellite, moving from west to southwest approximately 10 degrees above the treeline (about 50 degrees up from my position from the ground).  it was dim but visible until it got brighter over about 3-4 seconds and then dimmed again over another 3-4 seconds.  at its brightest, it was easily as bright as a plane's landing light coming straight at you (maybe 2-3 times as bright as a planet viewed with the naked eye).  i was able to follow the object with my binoculars for about a minute after it dimmed before i lost sight of it completely.  the second object i noticed during its first bright point.  it was very similar to the first, but travelled from the southwest to the northwest and was directly overhead.  it brightened and then dimmed twice while i observed it, both times brightening then dimming during the course of about 3-4 seconds.  this object i viewed only with the naked eye, but it started out very bright, then dimmed to satellite/dim star level, then disappeared completely, then it reappeared dimly, brightened, then dimmed again and disappeared from sight completely.  both sightings lasted about 30 seconds to a minute and were within 10 minutes of each other.  both objects followed straight flight paths very similar to what a satellite would travel.  i'm wondering if its possible for a satellite to reflect moonlight (it was very clear and the moon was nearly full) to produce the bright pulses i was seeing.
content.summary: 2 sightings within 10 minutes - satellite like but with extremely bright pulses.

content.detailedDescription: July 5, 2009. between 10:30 and 11:00pm est. i live on the south side of indianapolis, in. went out to see some of the lingering fireworks and a moving light caught my eye in the southern sky. just above the tree-line was a hovering object, composed of 5 glowing orange lights in a very tight pentagon shape. although my initial thought was that it was some sort of firework, as i continued to watch it, it didn't burn out as i would have expected a firework to.  in fact, the object continued to hover for a good three minutes, gliding slightly side to side, turned a little and then very slowly headed up.  during all this time the glowing orange lights did not dim or become lessened, although they rotated slightly as the object moved.  i still didn���t believe what i was seeing and ran back in to the house to get my husband.  at this point i was starting to believe i was seeing something not from this world and my heart was racing and i felt excited and a little scared.  by the time my husband came out, the object was still there, hovering. after we watched it for another 2-3 minutes, it continued to slowly glide up and gradually grew smaller as if it were getting farther away.  i said to my husband, "oh, they're leaving" - it looked as if it was a ship flying away.  and after a few more minutes finally became a tiny orange pinpoint of light and then it was too small to see.  i feel very intrigued by what i saw, and quite curious in thinking about what it might have been.  i've always been fascinated by the idea of visitors from other planets, but until tonight have not seen any first-hand evidence of it actually happening.  i only wish i hadn't been so caught up in watching and had thought to get my camera, as i do not have any physical documentation.
content.summary: Five orange lights arranged in a pentagon shape hovering near indianapolis, in.

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 2215edt, july 5, 2009 a orange colored light appeared in the sky over greencastle, indiana after a delayed independence day fireworks display. the object was at app. 5,000ft altitude traveling a straight and level course southbound towards the town of cloverdale at an estimated speed of 100mph. when the object was directly overhead we observed the object appeared to be circular or saucer shaped with 10-12 orange lights surrounding the rim. no sound could be heard from the object. we watched it until it disappeared to the south. no more than two minutes later another object appeared of the same size, shape, and light color and configuration as the first. the second object was traveling what appeared to be the same course and speed as the first and at the same altitude. we watched that object until it disappeared on the horizon the same as the first.
content.summary: Two sets of circular lights in the night sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I went to take my dog out before the evening's fireworks started, and i noticed several slow-moving bright red lights in the evening sky.  they formed a loose triangular formation, but there were at least four that i was able to see from my building.  they were moving very slowly (drifting) to the east (or so it appeared).  i knew this was like nothing i had ever seen before, and i stopped in my tracks to watch it for a few minutes before continuing on my dog's bathroom break.  

when i returned to the home, i showed them to my mother-in-law who is visiting from chicago.  she was under the impressino that maybe they were government or military related objects, perhaps relating to the north korean missile tests on the same day.  they seemed to be very high in the sky, and even when i looked through binoculars, there was no visible detail.  the lights looked electronic in nature, not from a natural or flame source.  at least one of them had a very soft "flicker" to it, but the rest were fairly constant.

we watched for a while, but there wasn't much action.  we figured they were just something normal, and went back inside.  when i looked later in the evening, they were gone.  

supposedly, according to various online sources that i have seen since (which is how i found this site), these same lights have been seen year after year over el cajon, ca on the 4th of july.  according to the sources that i saw, there has never been an official explanation.
content.summary: Bright red lights in varying formations.

content.detailedDescription: I was on duty as a driver for the cornwall emergency out-of-hours doctor's service on the night of august 23rd, 2004. we were attending a patient in hayle. the doctor was in the patient's house while i remained outside with the vehicle. i was standing beside the car pouring a cup of coffee when i noticed a bright flash in the sky towards the north. i thought it was a shooting star, but when i looked in that direction i was astonished to see an object which i couldn't identify burst into light and begin moving across the sky towards me. it was visible for some fifteen seconds, during which time it traversed an arc of about forty five degrees, moving at a steady rate due south until it was directly overhead with me staring up at it. i was so surprised i didn't even notice i was spilling coffee all over my trousers and shoes! at that point the lights went out and it simply disappeared. i searched a very bright, clear, moonlit sky for several minutes, but couldn't even see a silhouette. i am an ex soldier with a very keen interest in aircraft. the profile of this object resembled nothing i have ever seen or read about. i can only liken it to the plan view of an aircraft carrier's angled flight deck. it was brilliantly lit by bright blue lights surrounding each one of multiple panels covering the underside of the object. the blue lights made it difficult to see what colour the rest of the object was, but i could clearly make out shape and structure. i saw no wings, rotors or engines - it flew over me making no sound at all. i recall saying aloud, 'what the **** am i looking at?' just before it vanished. i made a quick sketch of what i'd seen and noted the time - 2330. i still do the same job - long night shifts out on the road - and i spend a lot of time watching the sky.
content.summary: Clear sighting of unidentified flying object over hayle in cornwall.

content.detailedDescription:
My family was coming home from a firework outing, and as we were waiting at a stop light, i looked into the sky and spotted a red dot. the closer it got, the more we could see the color..It was a reddish orange yellow. as you looked at it, it seemed like it was on fire, flaming. it was moving slowly, and it was a pretty nice size, bigger than a plane. we couldn't believe our eyes, and i swear our voices were raising, we started sweating, and our hearts were pounding. i didn't think to turn on the radio though, to see if there was static. the sight was not a normal thing to see, i was so surprised. this is something that i never saw before, and all four of us agreed that it was a ufo. 
it's funny because the entire time we were watching fireworks, my brother and i were talking about ufos.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Reddish orange flame in the sky, moving slowly.

content.detailedDescription: Approximately 9:45pm while on a boat on clear lake, we saw first one, then a few minutes later two orange-yellow orbs rise from near the horizon to above the clouds. they rose at a steady rate of speed, and maintained mostly a straight course up. yes, this was july 4th, but we feel strongly they were not fireworks due to the time of their ascent - over a minute, and also they disappeared behind a thin layer of high clouds. i have seen a missile launch from cape canaveral while in orlando, and these objects most closely resembled rocket launches in my opinion. they rose at a steady rate of speed, then disappeared beyond the high clouds. i did film them, but after watching my footage i wish i had done a much better job of filming.
content.summary: Three orange-yellow glowing orbs rising in eastern sky.

content.detailedDescription: On house roofdeck with 5 adult family members and 4 small children overlooking ocean and watching fireworks on beach.  red glowing ball/circle seems to either come up, or come from horizon from ocean and head in straight line towards our neighborhood atop hill on castle view drive in gloucester, mass.  turns dark and resembles large dark cirlcle type craft with glowing red sort of light moving in front part of craft.  craft was under clouds and moving very, very fast.  one of the adults was former captain in military (father 3 star general) and coments that it is like nothing he has ever seen in the military and they wouldnt be flying manuevers on july 4th evening.  also estimates craft is flying faster than the speed of sound.  craft is flying on straight path from beach and pretty much flies right over house and continues going in a atraight line (still about under clouds, in terms of altitude and about the size of our thumb in front of a cloud, so seemed pretty big is size) until we cannot see it any longer as it is too far off in the distance.  about 8 minutes goes by and exact same thing happens with another craft doing the exact same route.  another rough 8 minutes goes by and a 3rd time this same thing happens.  we are all pretty much going crazy in astonishment.  even all the kids are just in awe.  final 4th craft comes straight up from ocean/beach area (hard to tell as we do not have a direct view of the beach from house) and this one glows red and looks kind of like a very large orb.  at first we thought it may be part of a fireworks disply, but all the fireworks that we could see all end about the exact same height int he sky, way below the clouds.  this one just keeps slowly going up and up and finally though and over the cloulds alotogether.  that is when we knew it could not be a firework as it was way too high.  suddenly it just disapeared and that was it.  we waited outside about another 20 minutes but didnt see any more activity like this so called it an evening and went in.  everyone has spoken today and are all 100% convinced we witnessed some sort of ufo activity.  i decided to post this here in hopes maybe someone else saw what we did and has information.  also, on the beach today some neigbors commented they saw it too and had no clue what it was.
content.summary: 4 dark circle shaped objects witnessed by 5 adults flying over 30 minutes in gloucester, mass.

content.detailedDescription: 9:05 pm july 4th i went out my front door to listen to the fireworks. there are none nearby and absolutely none visible anywhere near my house. to the east there was a solid red light about the size and brightness of the brightest star in the sky but not at big or bright as venus appears. i waited for the light to blink like a plane but it did not. i got my meade 400mm telescope and locked on quickly. it was simply a pinpoint of redlight not flickering. the most logical explanation would be a suspended flare but it did not flicker and from living at the beach for a decade this didn't look like those emergency flares as it was solid, extrememly high and not moving. after comparing it against background stars it did move very slowly horizontally about the same speed as the moon or even less. it really struck me as an impossible red satellite as it appeared that far out, but there aren't any. if it was a flare it would have been ten miles away and several miles up and burning like a super led. the light did fade away into the darkness like a satellite, not like a flickering flare. other people in el cajon ca saw three and four lights. with my horizon blocked by trees and houses i would only see the highest.  here are other witness accounts: http://www.Examiner.Com/x-2363-ufo-examiner~y2009m7d5-annual-ufo-over-el-cajon-makes-fourth-of-july-appearance-once-again?#comments
content.summary: Red light stationary 45-50' up. not blinking moving horizontally about the speed of the moon.

content.detailedDescription: My wife, daughter and i were on our back porch and my wife and i at the same time saw a bright steady amber colored light coming from the western sky heading south.  it had no sound and was very high up in the sky.  my wife asked me "what the hell is that".  we ran through the house to the driveway (faces south) and watched this thing make a straight line almost looking like it flew into the moon and disappeard.  we of course were in a bit of disbelief and just stood there for a few minutes talking about it.  within 7 minutes, the exact same thing happened again only with a slightly different flight pattern.  it came from the exact same area in the sky but seemed to veer more to the west before going higher than the moon this time and again, vanished.  i had grabbed the camera between sightings and took some pictures which aren't great but i will try to post.  i couldn't hold the camera steady enough but perhaps the pics can be used to compare colors with any other recently taken photos.
content.summary: Saw two objects within 7 minues of each other that had bright amber colored lights fly from the western sky to the south and disappear.

content.detailedDescription: Was traveling back from anderson, heading west on s.R. 26 when i noticed an unusual orange ball of light about 60 degrees above horizion in the western sky, slighty north of 26.  it started out soft and fuzzy, got bright and then popped out completely.  then it popped back in brightly for a second or two and then disappeared for good.  it never moved from the same spot.  there were no clouds in the sky, the sky was clear and the temp was approx 60 degrees with a slight breeze.
content.summary: Orange ball of light blinks in and out.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting on my front porch looking east, toward greentown, watching the fireworks show when i noticed something that didn't look like an fireworks i have ever seen.  it was a white ball of light, about 1/10 the size of the nearly full moon  it was about 45 degrees above the horizon and was moving fast across the sky.  it did not appear to be upp in the atmosphere but rather pretty close to the ground.  it had a trail behind it like a comet's tail almost.  it was traveling from north to south.  the coyotes were going crazy and have been since dusk.
content.summary: Large white ball of light zips through sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving on the west 10 . when this big object flew close over the fwy. then drifted up untill disappeared. made no noise  had 3 lights two white bright lights at the ends and one red light
content.summary: Big triangle object with two white lights and one red light on it.

content.detailedDescription:
This information is in addition to the april 16, 2009 incident regarding a sound signature unlike anything heard before over the skies of pasadena.  i did not see an object in the sky as described in the original report but defiantly heard the sounds as they were described that night.  i am not military however i know sound signatures in the sky from years of experience.  the sounds heard in the sky that evening were not helicopter, jet or blimp in nature.  these sounds were magnetic resonance like.  a oscillatory humming sound with a slight low frequency penetration.  defiantly pulse like.  not monatomic at all.  not street sweeper sounds as initially thought might be as described in the official report.  all those machines could be identified blind-folded.  not this.

i was home alone that night watching tv and the sound was heard in the direction sw from my location.  the sound was overpowering the sound level on my tv.  this is why i became interested in the noise.  my wife was out of town.  however a week later to the day the same sounds were heard only this time my son was with me and he heard it too.  it freaked my son out just like the people from the original report.  i have to admit i was a bit concerned as well.  i am not sure where in pasadena the other people saw and heard this but i am near rt. 10 in pasadena.
content.summary: Strange sounds in sky over pasadena, md, april 16, 2009.

content.detailedDescription: Went outside for smoke, same object almost overhead and 2nd object now due east both making araddit patterns
content.summary: Same as yesterday - 2 objects.

content.detailedDescription:
Saw it moving slowly, realized it was not a plane, too big, thought maybe it was a paper or something from a firework but lasted too long, looked far away and very controlled movement then disappeared. at that point figured it may have been a satellite although really did not look like one.

about 10 minutes went by and saw it again, my daughter was with me thankfully because i would have thought i was going crazy if she did not see it also.

took a pic on my phone but it did not turn out well.
content.summary: Orange ball.

content.detailedDescription: Well to begin it was me and family and friends over at my house for the 4th.Then when some others were watching the fireworks from all over i hear my cousin go what the hell is that. when i looked up there were 4 glowing amber colored ojects fly in the sky with some distance in between them.We all seen it and people were like its helicopters but  they were way to high for that, i thought they were planes at first but they werent flashing and were very bright.My uncle was saying it could be missles but obvoulsy we would have heard bout that sometime after.They just flew north i belive following each other, they seem to be very high in the sky, and how i lost sight of them because of the trees and line of sight as they kept going, but one did look like it went more up than the others and just disappeared. if anyone else has seen hopefully some pictures will surface, my mother did take picturres but they did not come out very well and she erased them.
content.summary: 4 unknown objects fly through nw indiana.

content.detailedDescription:
Wa state:

watching fireworks a friend pointed out a "planet." but looking at it, it was moving very slowing.
it was red/orange in color and started off very large. we kept watching it and it would get as small as a faint star, and then return very brightly.

all the sudden there were two more objects, same in color and shape.
they were flying around each other in all different directions still moving east (i think it was east)
one would become fainter as if it was getting further away, the others brighter.
one continued to almost flicker out until it was gone, then another one.
the last one lingered for another 15 seconds before disappearing almost instantly.

our initial reaction was that it was firework embers, but clearly it was not, it made no noise, although it was the fourth, so fireworks were going off.

the stopping and going, and direction changes of the objects were too swift and fast looking to be a plane, helicopter ect..

and we decided we had never seen any aircraft that luminous in color.
we all knew what we saw....We were so hoping we were not the only ones!!! we have been on the internet since last night looking for anyone who saw something similar to what we did.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: Three red/orange objects flying in washington state city.
